rComments: Very passionate professor, but sometimes lectures are boring. Not his fault though, just not intense course material. Very possible to get 100% in the class
very caring prof but the lectures are kind of hard to follow since theres nothing but pictures on it

Awesome prof and it was clear by the way he lectured that he was really passionate about biology. His lecture slides weren't super detailed or full of textbook material, he gave plenty of real-world examples and case studies to deepen understanding of the material. Written questions on the exam were based on these such examples so pay attention!

Sure, he's a nice person however, I did not like this course with Ritcher at all. The tests were not fair in my opinion. His lectures were very boring and his slides are extremely unhelpful. Everything that he says in lecture is in the textbook so READ THE TEXTBOOK and take good, rather detailed notes.

He is a nice guy, but his course is not well organized. Lot of the test material comes from the slides, but since there is nothing but pictures on them you can't really take many notes of study off them later. If you missed a lecture then you are pretty screwed.

This course was amazing. Take good notes in the lecture cause the short answer on the term test is directly from the lecture. The test are easy, its just the short answer. Overall, he is a great prof. However, I do not like his lectures, as they only contain pictures.

Someone on here mentioned that a question in his second term test was very random. Incorrect, the phylogenetic tree was straight from the textbook and even explained in there. I just wish I actually paid more attention to the textbook for that test.
teacherRatingTags: ['Clear grading criteria', 'Participation matters', 'Get ready to read']

rComments: Hes ok. His first test was very easy, but his second test was full of random questions never covered in lecture or the textbook. However, he dropped 5 marks from the 2nd test so that brought a lot of peoples marks up. Exam was fair. If you skip lectures youll fail, his tests are purely test based but his exam short answer is all lecture based.
teacherRatingTags: ['Lecture heavy', "Skip class? You won't pass.", 'Get ready to read']

rComments: Read what I say very carefully. His lectures are beyond USELESS. I go to lecture and get nothing out of it. I read the textbook word-for-word and study really well and Im still not prepared for the test. Our test are not meant to be cumulative and yet, he made them that way. Assignment questions were unclear and he was rude when I asked to clarify.

Prof Richter is really sweet and you can tell that he is passionate about what he teaches. I really enjoyed going to his lectures and hearing his perspective on topics relating to the course material.
cool guy
He is nice and all, but his slides are completely unrelated and if you don't go to lecture they won't make sense. You end up basically teaching yourself the material.

The professor was clearly very interested and passionate about the course material (ecology), which enticed the students to take interest in it as well. Tests are very straightforward and mainly focus on lecture material, although the textbook does help in understanding broader concepts.

Dr. Richter is a great lecturer. His lectures are engaging, interesting, and he makes everything make sense. My stress level for the midterm is low because he has explained everything very well, I feel I understand all of the material thanks to him. His lecture material goes beyond the curriculum in which he applies Biology in our everyday life.
teacherRatingTags: ['Accessible outside class', 'Amazing lectures', 'Get ready to read']

rComments: Great Prof! Always sharing stories about his research for a more practical understanding of the material. Fair tests and very approachable for questions regarding the material. Use office hours, they're very useful!

i found myself unable to pay attention or care a lot of times during this lecture, the material often felt like it didnt mean anything and i wasnt sure what to take notes on cause it was just stories. the labs got revamped for my year and werent at all bad but they were still a long shot from great

i loved this prof and his course ,he was very interesting and the lectures were super fun and engaging . the only thing is that the lectures don't cover much material so study from the textbook for you midterms but i would say it's an easy A but make sure to study.

Tests are mainly based off the material in the textbook. He wrote the textbook so obviously he's gonna format the course like that lol. Exam was based off textbook material and lecture discussions. Make SURE to fully read assigned chapters before tests, and review the main lecture discussions for the exam and you'll do great. He made lectures fun.
teacherRatingTags: ['Get ready to read', 'Accessible outside class', 'Gives good feedback']

rComments: The sweetest prof I've ever had, his lectures are very interesting but do not cover a lot, so make sure to thoroughly read through assigned readings. He loves when students participate and show interest in lectures, feel free to chat with him! As long as you keep up with readings and take good notes at the lectures, you're bound to get an 80!

The sweetest prof I've ever had, his lectures are very interesting but do not cover a lot, so make sure to thoroughly read through assigned readings for the tests. As long as you keep up with readings and take good notes at the lectures, you're bound to get an 80!
Lectures are boring but the tests and assignments are easy. Just be sure to do the readings for term tests because some content is not covered in lectures. Easy course and not too heavy material.
Loved his way of teaching and dealing with course materials, makes content sound pretty interesting and simple. Favourite professor.

He is a friendly person, but not the best at teaching. His slides are just full of pictures with no words. His lectures are mainly just real life examples, with almost nothing relating to the course textbook. He ended up basing the final exam only on his lectures, which is why it is very important to attend class!

He is one of the most helpful and friendly profs ever! His lectures are amazing( if you like biology). His tests are based a lot on textbook material so DO YOUR READINGS. He makes you interested in scientific research and helps you a lot. He is a very sweet person too.  He encourages you to learn more and get involved in research.
teacherRatingTags: ['Amazing lectures', 'Get ready to read', 'Accessible outside class']

rComments: I feel like by the time I get my marks back, I'll be graduating. Other than that, easy class.
Extremely helpful and dedicated

I loved his lectures and the examples he provided for class. After having him for 2 courses, i have noticed that his midterms are more based on the textbook and the exam had questions about stuff mainly from the lectures, which is why it's very crucial to go to class and take notes on what he talks about!

He is nice and friendly, but the textbook is your real prof. If you don't have the textbook, chances are you won't do well. It's pointless to take notes in his lectures because he hardly covers anything substantial. His lecture slides are mostly pictures and one or two sentences. I found the course interesting, but only because of the textbook.

Don't expect to do well unless you have the test bank. It may be possible to get a good grade if you are a type of student who can memorize every single word in the textbook AND then able to answer various application questions without learning.

He's a nice guy and clearly knows his stuff but as a lecturer, he's not good. His powerpoints have one sentence on each slide and he talks for ten minutes about that one idea which is the worst thing for me who needs information presented visually. Taking lecture notes is pointless and the textbook will be your prof.
teacherRatingTags: ['Caring', 'Graded by few things', 'Get ready to read']

rComments: This course makes you fall in love with Ecology, prof Richter is very knowledgeable and helpful. I loved listening to different Ecological research examples that he brings up during lectures.

As long as you do the reading required and make good notes during his lectures you will do good on tests and the exam! His ppt slides are not detailed at all so you need to pay attention and make good notes since the final exam was based mostly off his lecture. The lab tests are NOT that hard you need to read the labs before each lab and study!!
pretty good class! learned lots of cool animal facts, went to all the lectures and read the textbook, got an 89. very important to do the lab readings regularly if you wanna do well on the lab test.

Hated the class in trams of content, a lot of memorization for the lab tests. Study hard for those.   Very boring lectures (practically didn't attend any), and the exam was mostly lecture based even though he said it was going to be mostly textbook questions. Included questions from tutorials on the exam, which was a big surprise.
The lectures didn't cover a lot of material but were very interesting if you like this kind of biology (organisms and diversity). The labs dealt with viewing and classifying different organisms .

its okay if you don't go to his lectures (he doesn't cover much anyway), read the TEXTBOOK, do the questions in the textbook, do past tests and exams. Lab tests were hard and the assignments were marked roughly...
Lectures had little substance. Hard to take notes. Dishonest about final exam content(claimed textbook heavy, virtually all lecture). Very slow marking.
LECTURES ARE A WASTE OF TIME( MOST OF THE CONTENT IS IRRELEVANT) BUT HE IS A GOOD PROF.
worst first year class ever. so glad, i never have to take this class again

I love biology but taking Richter's class had me considering chemistry as a specialist instead (yeah, it's that bad). In all honesty, I studied two days before tests and still did well BUT assignments killed my mark, not to mention the lab tests. The course is easy in terms of content but Ritcher brings down the marks with assignments and lab tests
You don't need to go to his lecture if you don't enjoy biology. His lecture is more focusing on real biology not on the material or tests. Tests are really hard, especially lab tests.
Boring, slow lectures. Not much covered in lectures anyway. Textbook  life.

Many people dislike his teaching but I absolutely love him! He is very interesting to listen to and this course had great content. The tests are fair, however many of his MC are repeated from online test banks and past midterms. SO TAKE ADVANTAGE!
The content of this course was pretty dry so I don't blame him for being difficult to pay attention to. Labs were a lot harder and the exam was brutal. You don't know what to expect.

I don't know about everyone else, but Professor Richter's lectures were amazing,  very inspirational!  I've taken BIO153, 205, as well with him and liked that his slides weren't so cluttered.  Attendance is a must! Lectures summarize key concepts from the book, across his courses, so pay attention (crucial for stats), that's all you need for tests.

WORST COURSE I HAVE EVER TAKEN IN MY LIFE!!! First test is fair. Second test was awful, you have to memorize every world in the readings. Lab tests are a nightmare. Assignments are ridiculous and graded with no mercy. Worthless lectures, but you HAVE to attend them all because the exam was entirely lecture based.  Most useless course at UTM.
I don't wanna try this course again, never.

Not a good prof. Lectures seem useless until you reach the exam, where lecture information show up on the short answer! Midterms are 80% textbook and are fair. Exam short answer is  pure lecture content, with a major focus on ecology. Lab tests require intense studying. LiteracyNumeracy assignments must be done well to boost your mark!

Prof. Richter has the most vague, irrelevant lectures ever and then makes the tests  ridiculously difficult. Even memorizing the textbook cover to cover wouldn't have been helpful. Protip: Look up practice test questions related to the textbook publisher online. His course doesn't teach you biology; it teaches you how to be good at tests.

Unfortunately he is the only one who teaches Bio153 at UTM which is a course which is a prereq for upper year courses. Never again will I take a class with this guy! The exam is a killer. The term tests are killers too. The lab tests are in bell ringer format. And the Ta's are insanely hard when it comes to grading assignments.

This human being needs to retire and just disappear from the sacred field of biology, never be able to touch the mike again. Words out of his mouth, I rather listen to a stray dog bark because I'm positive I will learn more bio through that than listen to this guy's nonsense. I really want my money and time back. How do you succeed with BS?

This prof 's lectures are the most boring thing in the world. I prefer to sleep on the bed rather than sleeping in his lecture. Not a helpful prof. at all too, ignoring questions on portalwith BS responses.   Exams and tests are mainly textbook based, you are not gonna find answers in his lecture and textbook

I enjoy bio overall. However, this professor will not teach you anything regarding the course material during his lecture. He will literally kill time talking and introducing broad topics, just by reading off the titles. It is evident that this individual is only a professor to make a living, no attention given towards the materials for students.

Richter was MUCH better at teaching 205 than 153. I never really liked ecology, but he made it interesting and so I actually enjoyed the class and participated. Textbook is a must, since the lecture slides are pretty much empty. The tutorials are HUGE mark boosters, and being 35% of your grade, a 4.0 is doable for the course.

His lectures don't really get into the material that we are required to know. Lectures are interesting and engaging; however, attending lectures is nowhere near as important as reading and self teaching the textbook.
Nice Prof. You should always compliment lectures with readings though that's the only way to get a good mark.
Richter is pretty rude in my opinion. I didn't respect him as a teacher because he didn't seem to care about the students, and somehow found a way to talk about nothing for an entire semester.

Term tests are extremely hard. He absolutely explains nothing in his lectures. READ THE TEXTBOOK. Idk why he even bothers with lectures, he should just tell ppl to read the goddamn textbook. His multiple choice are confusing.

His tests were difficult on purpose in order to make the assignments and group work in tutorial much easier. He made us buy his textbook but it was a blessing because it was really easy to read from. He enjoys what he teaches and its evident by the smile on his face every time he showed up to class. Study from the textbook and it'll be an easy 4.0

Richter has a really good understanding of the course material, however class lectures are vague. He makes it unclear as to what he wants us to focus on. The exam consisted of 50 multiple choice questions and 10 short answers that required at least half a page and possible diagrams. Difficult. Very tough marker.

I had him for BIO153 and I must say his lectures were always interesting but his tests were sooo difficult. This year in 205 hes AMAZING, so much more passionate about what he teaches. He spends time to review in lectures, his tests are extremely fair, a mix of lecture textbook. He really made me enjoy 205 when i wasn't much of an ecology person!
Most boring class I've ever taken. I still got 4.0 though, doing well is doable just study hard.

I had a much better experience in BIO 205 than BIO 153.  My best advice is to map concepts from his lectures that are also discussed in the textbook.  His test consists of multiple choice, which are mainly derived from textbook concepts, and there is a short answer portion which comes from lecture examples.  Good luck!

I respect him as a professor because by his lectures, you can tell he REALLY loves what he does. However, in a nutshell: In lecture, he grasps a few key concepts from the textbook and explains minimally, rest of lecture is just examples. BUT WILL TEST ON THE KEY CONCEPTS IN MUCH MORE DEPTH. Lectures are not important. READ the textbook, that's it.
The lectures were not very helpful. Read the text book and study hard for the lab tests! Good Luck!

Richter is a very nice and approachable guy and loves engaging in discussion with his students. His tests were pretty specific, and they introduced 'graded response' multiple choice that brought class averages down a lot. The exam seemed fair, but after getting marks back everyone did about 10% worse than expected which really made no sense.
He's a nice person and very knowledgeable, but not the greatest instructor. Lectures that seem to drag on for ever about unessential info. Rawle is the better instructor by a mile.

Great prof! Very passionate about what he's teaching and very fun and interactive lectures but his tests and exams are NOT easy. You need to read the textbook as well as go to lectures and take good notes. Much better experience in BIO205 than BIO153 with him. He makes a rather dull and boring subject pretty interesting and marking is always fair.

Professor Richter is a good prof who knows what hes talking about and is very nice but his tests and exams are ABSOLUTE killers. I am never taking a course with him again because no matter what course it is the exam will drop your mark by at least 5%. HORRIBLE experience with him

Good prof. up until the exam. His lectures seem really irrelevent but make sure  you take careful notes, it was a big suprise on the exam when he had many questions based on his notes. I dropped 8% because of this!

Don't be fooled -- this course requires a ton of work. As I sailed through BIO152 I thought that I would get by in 153 no problem.. I was wrong. Read the textbook, study your butt off for the lab tests, and do practice questions in the textbook. You'll be fine! Richter just thinks all of this is so easy so he doesn't do a great job of explaining

His multiple choice questions were pretty easy, just read the textbook. The short answer questions however were hard and he focused on the most recent lectures before the test/exam for these. For the lab tests, memorize every single little detail and use the atlas to study the organisms. Overall, he was fair

He isn't a bad prof. Although lectures aren't necessary, he does occasionally put short answer questions from stuff he focused on in lectures. READ THE TEXTBOOK! The midterms/lab tests were HARD. Insignificant/irrelevant details are asked and TAs are extremely harsh in their marking. If you work really hard, you can do well on the course.
no comment.......

This course honestly made me hate biology. Dint really learn stuff and don't really see the point of taking this course since I hate ecology/botany/zoology and no even going in it. I think this course should not be mandatory for 1st year. The prof made it even worse, lectures are useless and the 2nd midterm was badass. He just loves whales.

The lectures were really boring and pointless that I stopped going to them after a certain point.i get that he tries to make the lecs interesting but it just isn't happening. Exams weren't so great :( lab tests...don't even get me started! Basically this course was a pain in the butt and the prof didn't do much to help.

I am going to fail this exam tomorrow for sure. So much stuff to know that I don`t think I`ll ever be ready for the exam. The TAs mark your papers but don`t know why they marked it the way they did. Since its about diversity, the prof should have made more effort to keep it more organized and fair. But life with him as a teacher in your life= hell

Worst prof I've ever had. Disorganized, doesn't advise his students of anything. Won't even tell us how many short answers are on our exam. Too busy with whales to realized there are students paying nearly $600 for him to teach us stuff we give a care about.

Okay you DONT need to attend his lectures,they're so useless. However he's an unfair prof for the stuff he puts on the tests, not all of it is textbook based, and some of it the test content is based on very insignificant info frm the textbooks.
AMAZING

His good looks make it easy to go to class, even if you hate the course ;) overall I find his tests/exams are hard if you don't read the textbook. He also has great whale stories to lighten the mood of the class! A cute and fun prof :)
Perfect prof. ,am not a fan of stats but with him it was pretty interesting, especially with the practical examples he had. Tests are fair and assignments are tooo easy and helpful :))

This class was in 2nd term, and it was SOOOOO fun. The prof would insert these wild stories into his lectures that made them a lot more interesting. But make sure to go to lecture, I was absent once and the lecture ended up on the final exam with like 8 questions. Overall, good prof and funnest class so far. The labs are super awesome.

Honestly I found his lectures to be kind of irrelevant to what was actually needed for the course and very repetitive the most important thing for this course is the labs if you don't ace the labs you basically will fail the course so do not take them lightly it's 45% of your mark

Amazing whale-loving Prof! Lectures, very engaging, were mostly examples but they do relate to textbook material.  He makes you appreciate the world and everything in it! Make sure to do all the readings and attend all the lectures .  Just an awesome prof! Very happy to have taken this class with him.:)
Somehow managed to make ecology interesting and Monday mornings bearable. Course is super easy.

prof Richter is very interested in what he teaches. He studies whales and likes to bring them up whenever he can. He's always smiling and  really nice so he makes u wanna go to class. He's a cutie so it's not hard not attend his lectures ;) His lecture slides aren't detailed so u should go to lectures b/c the exam was based mostly on lectures.

Amazing professor, very easy to follow and makes you enjoy something as difficult as the topic of diversity. Readings are essential for the midterm BUT for the exam, he tends to focus on the most recent lecture material, which is why the exam is so hard since we study straight from the textbook. All in all, he's a great prof!

What an awesome professor! Loved going to his lectures since they were always so interesting. There was never a time when I didn't learn something completely out of the box and  unheard of in his lectures. The tests were easy,most from past year's tests :X and the exam was a fair game. Go to his lectures and pay attention! You'll be fine :)

Whatever he teaches in class has no relevance to the textbook whatsoever. TERRIBLE TA's. Might not be his fault but TA's do what he tells them to do, right? I guess it's experience that he requires to know how to get his students good grades. This is my second semester at UTM, i did first semester Bio with 85% final grade. Not confident this time.

He seems interested in what he teaches... different style than what a lot of people are used to. Encourages collaboration. Doesn't want you to memorize concepts, but rather understand them... midterm was stupid-easy, final was awful. Overall, meh.
